quote.quotepara: Storage/Filesystem: not known with absolute certainty. NeXT had VFS (virtual file system), so Rhapsody should, too. This lets it run on top of other file systems.
I don't think this is accurate. We did have a plug-in architecture for additional file systems.. but we never had this..

body.para: Actually, we did, it was just never quite well documented. See: /NextDeveloper/Headers/bsd/sys/vfs_stat.h /NextDeveloper/Headers/bsd/sys/vfs.h

quote.quotepara: NTFS has been there in the past.
Nope. DOS was... but not NTFS..

body.para: NTFS wasn't supported by NeXT/Apple, however, there was a free implementation based on a user-level NFS interface, that used some Linux code (I think) to support at least read-only NTFS access (maybe it was even read/write, I never tested or installed the software, for lack of need/want).

quote.quotepara: No STREAMS compatibility is planned for Rhapsody.. I don't think Apple has every claimed there would be.

body.para: They didn't, but maybe they expose the private Streams to sockets conversion layer they must have somewhere to make BlueBox work properly.
Greetings, and happy holidays to all...
